name: Syringa
description: Syringa, better known as Lilac, is a genus of about 20 species of deciduous shrubs or trees in the olive family (Oleaceae), native to Eurasia.Lilacs are one of the best known spring-flowering plants. They produce incredibly fragrant, tubular flowers which capture the essence of spring. Lilacs come in different shapes, sizes and colors, encouraging everyone to admire them and use them in different ways.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek word “syrinx”, which means “tube” or “pipe”, in reference to the hollow branches of the species Syringa vulgaris.
color_description: Although they get their common name from their most popular color, Lilacs can also be found in other colors such as blue, red, pink, white and yellow.
